CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 25, 1950, pg. 4, reads: "Convicted Slayer - Ollie Strickland, 37-year-old Georgia worker, ducks the camera as he is led from Judge J. Frank Graff's courtroom Tuesday. Strickland pleaded guilty to the knife slaying of his wife, Ovie, last Sept. 24, in a Hill District room when she refused to accompany him back to Georgia.  Judge Graff fixed the crime at second-degree murder and sentenced Strickland to the Western Penitentiary for ten to twenty years....-Teenie Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Two men, including Ollie Strickland on right, escorted by police officer from courtroom after second degree murder conviction in the Allegheny County Courthouse
